info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 08 at 5:35PM EST until January 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River Near Greenville affecting Greenville and Pickens Counties. .A potent storm system is expected to produce 3-5 inches of rainfall across the upper Saluda River watershed from from early Tuesday morning through early Tuesday evening. This rainfall will quickly overwhelm saturated soils and result in excessive runoff and significant stream rises for all forks of the Saluda River and associated tributaries. Minor to Moderate flooding of some tributaries is likely beginning late Tuesday morning or early Tuesday afternoon. This excessive flow will cause portions of the upper Saluda River to exceed bankfull or Action/Advisory Stage as early as Tuesday evening. The Saluda River may stay above bankfull levels through Wednesday afternoon, causing common, nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. If rainfall totals significantly exceed current forecasts, higher crests along the upper Saluda River may occur, resulting in deeper inundation of common, flood-prone areas adjacent to the river. If necessary, a River Flood Warning may be required. Residents, business owners, and recreational river users are encouraged to stay up-to-date by monitoring the latest river levels and forecasts, as conditions may change quickly. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Minor flooding is possible. * WHERE...Saluda River near Greenville. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Action/Advisory Stage. Common, nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to the Saluda River is beginning. Floodwaters are beginning to impact farmland, woodlands, nurseries, parks, athletic fields, golf courses, greenways, and boat-access areas with up to 2 feet of inundation. Floodwaters are likely beginning to impact the lowest elevation of residential yards along Shop Ct, Covenant Dr, Riverview Dr, and Riverview Cir. At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Common, deeper flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to the Saluda River is developing with lesser impacts to vulnerable property. More significant floodwaters are beginning to impact low-lying areas downstream of Saluda Dam, including the lowest elevation of residential yards along Shop Ct, Covenant Dr, Riverview Dr, Riverview Cir, and Old Easley Bridge Rd. Floodwaters may be approaching River Rd near Myers Ln. Residents next to the river need to take precautions to protect vulnerable property, closely monitor the latest river levels and forecast, and follow guidance from Pickens and Greenville County Emergency Management. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EST Monday the stage was 3.5 feet and steady. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.7 feet early Wednesday morning. The river may continue to rise to near or just above Minor Flood Stage Wednesday morning. If the river significantly exceeds Minor Flood Stage, a River Flood Warning may be issued. Please closely monitor the latest levels and forecasts. - Action/Advisory Stage is 8.0 feet. - Minor Flood Stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued beforeThursday evening at 700 PM EST.
